title: recommendations for getting to silver from bronze
body: hey all, as the title says any recommendations for champions and tips for getting to silver and out of bronze. Right now i find annie, rammus, vayne, tristana  and kha and strong picks for each lane. are these good in other peoples opinion for s8? and also any other tips you could give me to get to silver quickest (1-2 months). another problem i have is that most games i play i do well, its just my team members tilting and not cooperating. ty for listening please add me if you can help or give me advice!

replies.body: What are your two main lanes?
I switch around a lot of the time however my most played lanes are ad and jungle. Just played some jax jog actually and seem good. Lost 8 games in a row though any thoughts?

Alright as a low elo player here are the best tips you should follow:

1. Focus only on playing and getting good at two roles.

2. Have roughly 2-3 champions per role that you are comfortably good with.

3. In case of stupid autofill, make sure you have 1-2 champions for every other role that you KNOW how to play at the very least.

4. To better help you at climbing, look at champion.gg and see which champions have the highest winrate for your two selected roles and try playing them as frequently as you can, it will increase your chances of winning drastically.

The reason why it's best to try and focus on and master two roles is because the game will be much easier to win when you are against opponents you've faced many times before and know how to play against. Also playing the same two roles all the time means that you will also be playing the same group of champions all the time so your experience on how to play them in certain matchups will be much better.

Take me for example, I've played Top lane for 3 years, so I've pretty much faced EVERY single top lane champion that exists in the game at least 10+ times. My main champions are Darius, Jax, Tryndamere but I also play Renekton, Vlad, and Fiora very frequently. Since I queue up for top as my primary role I pretty much play one of these 6 champions almost 90% of all my games. So I have A LOT of experience on these champions which means not only do I have a lot of knowledge on how to PLAY them, but also how to play them AGAINST every other toplaner, even against some in my own champion pool.

Also regarding autofill, don't waste your time trying to practise getting really good at a lot of champions in EVERY role, it's seriously not worth the time compared to how frequently you actually get autofilled. Seeing as though you get autofilled 1 in every 10 games, it's not worth the time you could be spending getting good at the roles you play 9 out of every 10 games.

also try playing every champion in your main role "at least once". You don't need to master them, but playing a decent game from start to finish really helps you work out what the intentions of the player would be on that champion, see the limits, the weaknesses, the plays, the opportunities they would be looking for, and essentially, how to counter that champion. It really helps to be able to imagine what your opponent is thinking and being able to punish them for it.
Ty for the help and recommendations it means a lot!
Jungle is in my opinion the easiest place to carry from, I would suggest warwick, amumu, evelyn, rammus, DARKIN kayn. These guys can basically rofl stomp bronze mmr.

Ori/Anivia/Syndra/Ziggs are free wins mid (for me anyways, they're are fairly simple and mechanically don't require too much)
Thresh/Leo/Braum are in good spots as supports
Illaoi/Camille/Darius are your best bets top (although camille/illaoi are mechanically intense, wave control/teamfighting/split pushing etc)
Any adc with overheal/relic combo would be fine

Learn one champion for one position :) quickest and easiest way to learn. Just make sure you have a sub champion in-case it gets picked or banned.
